content:
Anyone familiar with UserWay? Someone asked if we could install the widget and I'm doing a little research into it (I've never heard of it).
https://userway.org/

Make your website accessible in minutes with UserWay's Accessibility Solutions
UserWay is a pioneer in innovative website accessibility technologies. We provide helpful accessibility solutions that work without refactoring your website's existing code and will increase compliance with WCAG 2.1, ATAG 2.0, EN 301 549, ADA, & Section 508 requirements.
Never heard of it @Laryn but seems interesting :+1:

The topic is very interesting, but I'm a bit skeptical regarding this vendor. Their homepage mainly promotes their widget. In how far is it any better than, for instance http://wave.webaim.org/ (which doesn't require to accept any terms of service, privacy policy...)?
(I know, I'm paranoid :wink: )

@indigoxela Me, too (paranoid that is) but this is not a testing tool, it actually provides a UI to your end users. Try clicking the accessibility icon in the top right of their site and see the options it provides. Looks like they have a freemium type arrangement where you can use it without charge but have to pay to remove their logo and donate links...

https://github.com/liip/TheA11yMachine was mention over in the Drupal Slack chat.

liip/TheA11yMachine
The A11y Machine is an automated accessibility testing tool which crawls and tests pages of any web application to produce detailed reports. - liip/TheA11yMachine

klonos said:

https://github.com/liip/TheA11yMachine was mention over in the Drupal Slack chat.

Nice, there's one problem, though: this project has been archived. (TheA11yMachine is no longer maintained.)
Yes, I've noticed that ...sad, but people over in the Drupal Slack seem to still be using it.
